ags:resource.dc:title: Evaluasi keaslian benih beberapa varietas padi melalui pengujian di pertanaman (On Growing Test)

dc:title.dcterms:alternative: Evaluation genuineness of three rice-varieties used on growing test methods

ags:resource.ags:creatorConference: scientific seminar on national rice research results 2010

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The experiment had been conducted in The Indonesian Centre for Rice Research on 2008. The activity started by enumeration of secondary data of variety distribution in Centre of Java Province, followed by buying seeds of three varieties produced by three different seed producers. Prior to planting the seeds were evaluated for their physical and physiological quality. Evaluation of genuineness of some variety was done by on growing test. Morphological characters were recorded from seedling phase until harvest. Data of distribution of variety showed that the five-broadest varieties planted in Central Java Province in 2007 was IR64 (62.1 percent), followed by Ciherang (27.4 percent), Ciasadane (3.4 percent), Memberamo (1.9 percent) and Cilamaya Muncul (1.6 percent) respectively. Result of this experiment showed that seeds sample taken from Central Java had high physical and morphological quality. There were no differences in plant growth, grain yield and yield component between plantation using seed produced by seed producers and from the authentic seeds (Nucleus seeds). Also there were no differences in all morphological-characters-evaluated between plantation using seed produced by three seeds producers and from authentic seeds, or in another word the seeds were true-to-the varieties.
